content: The `convert_doxygen_format` function is part of an extension module that enhances Sphinx's autodocumentation capabilities. It specifically handles the conversion of Doxygen-style comments into Sphinx-compatible markup, ensuring seamless integration for projects transitioning from Doxygen or utilizing both documentation systems. def convert_doxygen_format(line, name, domain='py'): """Converts a single line of Doxygen formatting to Sphinx. The name argument is the fully qualified name of the current module, class or function, and is used to resolve references.""" line = line.replace('', '**').replace('', '**') # Single backticks in doxygen map to doubles in Sphinx line = line.replace('`', '``') # But double backticks are literal backticks line = line.replace('````', '\\`') # @c and @p result in double backticks for the subsequent word line = re.sub(at_c_at_p_pattern, r'``\1``', line) parent = name.rsplit('.', 1)[-1]
